Description: Torso, long, narrow and rudely sculpted figure in limestone. Head and feet missing. Back flat and plain. Plain full length garment fastens over left shoulder. Left arm at side, and right arm across chest. "F10" written in pencil on the back.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ10
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked AP and Φ10 (or 18?) (Temple of Aphrodite context 10 or 18, described as 10 in stone ledger). From Naukratis, Temple of Aphrodite.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.005) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
